etymologies: mid 16th century (in the general sense ‘race, breed’): from Spanish and Portuguese casta ‘lineage, race, breed’, feminine of casto ‘pure, unmixed’, from Latin castus ‘chaste’

definitions: each of the hereditary classes of Hindu society, distinguished by relative degrees of ritual purity or pollution and of social status

notes.text: There are four basic classes, or varnas, in Hindu society: Brahman (priest), Kshatriya (warrior), Vaishya (merchant or farmer), and Shudra (laborer)

shortDefinitions: each of hereditary classes of Hindu society, distinguished by relative degrees of ritual purity or pollution

definitions: the system of dividing society into hereditary classes

examples.text: caste has survived among Goa's Christians

shortDefinitions: system of dividing society into castes

definitions: any class or group of people who inherit exclusive privileges or are perceived as socially distinct

examples.text: those educated in private schools belong to a privileged caste

shortDefinitions: any class or group of people who inherit exclusive privileges

definitions: (in some social insects) a physically distinct individual with a particular function in the society

examples.text: in both ants and termites the workers can include specialist castes such as soldiers

shortDefinitions: (in some social insects) class of physically distinct individuals with particular function in society
